result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Nicholas A. Toth was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Possess SH. I,II Drugs-Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Nicholas A. Toth was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 16CF46, 16CF151,16CF322, 16CT67 called together at 10:19am [ma]
Defendant Nicholas A. Toth in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall motions to dismiss case 16CT67 as the charges are now encompassed within case 16CF46

The Court indicates that it cannot accept the amended criminal complaint since an Arraignment has already occurred in 16CF46
--ADA Hall will file an Amended Information that includes the additional charges
                                                                                                  
As to Case 16CF46 an Amended Information is filed:
--service admitted; reading waived

As to Case 16CF322, Waiver of Preliminary occurs:
Mr. Toth  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

ADA Hall motions to dismiss case 16CT67
--no objection from Atty. Svehlek
The Court dismisses Case 16CT67; gives basis

ADA Hall motions to amend Count #1 of Case 16CF46 to possession of THC as second or subsequent offense
--no objection from Atty. Svehlek
The Court amends Count #1 of Case 16CF46 to simple possession of THC as second or subsequent offense, removing the intent
The Court and Parties clarify that the modifier of 'on or near certain places' remains

On the Motion of Parties, The Court dismisses outright Count #3 of Case 16CF322

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; 
Pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1 and #4 of Case 16CF46
Pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1 and #4 of Case 16CF322
Factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all remaining counts of all cases

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Toth

As to Case 16CF46, Count #4:
The Court sentences Mr. Toth to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence previously imposed
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To pay fine of $600+ costs
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--random drug/alcohol screens
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without DL and Agents approval
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise as deemed appropriate per Agent
The Court orders: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period 
--provide DNA sample upon demand

As to Case 16CF151, Count #3, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve 3 months   in the Jefferson County Jail consecutive to sentence in 16CF46
--To pay fine of $650+ costs and $25 drug testing fee; to be converted to civil judgment
--Revocation of drivers license for 24 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 24 month period 

As to Case 16CF46, Count #1: 
--To serve 4 months   in the Jefferson County Jail to be served consecutive to any other sentence 
--statutory costs and $50 drug testing fees; to be converted to civil judgment

As to Case 16CF322, Counts #1 and #4:  the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, consecutive to sentences in Cases 16CF151 and 16CF46, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--random drug/alcohol screens
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without DL and Agents approval
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise as deemed appropriate per Agent
--submit DNA sample upon demand
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay $75 drug testing fee

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

The Court grants 2 days credit on Case 16CF46; all other cases 0 days credit
recess: 11:37am

Defendant Nicholas A. Toth in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Case #16CF46 and #16CT67 (joined cases) are scheduled for FSSC today and for Jury Trial next week, however Attorney Svehlek requests adjournment, explaining that Mr. Toth is currently without his medications and this is resulting in Mr. Toth being anxious and feeling unprepared to proceed to trial. 
After a discussion with the parties, the Court grants the trial adjournment request.

--Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited

--Case #16CF322 Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

--in Case #16CF322, the Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:

Cases 16CT50, 16CT67 & 16CF46 called together at 8:55 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Nicholas A. Toth in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On Oral Motion to Modify Bond in Case 16CF46 by Defense:
Arguments by Atty Svehlek; No objection by State, concerns presented

Court presents basis and modifies bond and requires a $5,000 signature bond with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores except as required for employment purposes at Gunnarz Pub and Grill, Watertown
-Not to drive without a valid drivers license
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician
-No possession of drug paraphernalia unless prescribed by a physician
-The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

16CT50 & 16CT67:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
Upon agreement of the State, the Court includes 16CT50 & 16CT67 into 16CF46 bond

Recess: 9:03 am
